stories.text:
What I mean is that auto-correct often silently changes the second to last word thereby making it hard to notice. For me this introduces a significant amount of spelling errors that I only notice once it's too late. Disabling auto-correct in the keyboard settings unfortunately doesn't get rid of this behaviour. Often when I pick a suggestion it also adds an unnecessary space character. I fully expected this to be silently improved with iOS 15 and I just can't wrap my head around such problems existing in the open for so long. Overall these editing warts give an unusually unpolished feel for such a basic task.

Meanwhile with Googles GBoard I don't have these problems, get better suggestions and a much broader vocabulary which is very useful for entering words by swiping. The only reason I use the default keyboard is that GBoard for some reason makes long-hold-for-cursor buggy for me.
stories.title: Ask HN: How come iOS has such a bad user experience for text editing by default?
What evolution tells us about how to brainstorm?
